result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jawantay L Charles

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jawantay L Charles appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Jawantay L Charles.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jawantay L Charles not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Jawantay L Charles.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's appearance waived as status conference was scheduled for 8/22/2022 and Attorney Obscherning was unable to pass the Milwaukee County health protocol screening. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jawantay L Charles in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jawantay L Charles appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in need of an offer but has discovery and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jawantay L Charles in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Jawantay L Charles in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jawantay L Charles appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for Initial appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
